Parametric Hypothesis Tests
text:
import Pkg
Pkg.activate(".")
using CSV
using DataFrames
using Statistics
using HypothesisTests

  Activating project at `~/Programs/Julia/contrib-dataalltheway/Julia/Quarto/posts/010-parametric-hypothesis-tests`

title: Parametric Hypothesis Tests
text:
Unpaired 2 sample Z test

uneqvarztest = let
    # Fetch a random sample of BMI data for women in the year 1985 and 2017
    x1 = filter([:Sex, :Year] => (s, y) -> s=="Women" && y==1985 , data) |>
        x -> x[!, :BMI] |> skipmissing |> collect |> x->rand(x, 300)
    x2 = filter([:Sex, :Year] => (s, y) -> s=="Women" && y==2017 , data) |>
        x -> x[!, :BMI] |> skipmissing |> collect |> x->rand(x, 300)
    UnequalVarianceZTest(x1, x2)
end

Two sample z-test (unequal variance)
------------------------------------
Population details:
    parameter of interest:   Mean difference
    value under h_0:         0
    point estimate:          -2.12733
    95% confidence interval: (-2.539, -1.716)

Test summary:
    outcome with 95% confidence: reject h_0
    two-sided p-value:           <1e-23

Details:
    number of observations:   [300,300]
    z-statistic:              -10.125253560375084
    population standard error: 0.21010173430703924

title: Parametric Hypothesis Tests
text:
Paired 2 sample Z test

eqvarztest = let
    # Fetch a random sample of BMI data for women in the year 1985 and 2017
    x1 = filter([:Sex, :Year] => (s, y) -> s=="Women" && y==1985 , data) |>
        x -> x[!, :BMI] |> skipmissing |> collect |> x->rand(x, 300)
    x2 = filter([:Sex, :Year] => (s, y) -> s=="Women" && y==2017 , data) |>
        x -> x[!, :BMI] |> skipmissing |> collect |> x->rand(x, 300)
    EqualVarianceZTest(x1, x2)
end

Two sample z-test (equal variance)
----------------------------------
Population details:
    parameter of interest:   Mean difference
    value under h_0:         0
    point estimate:          -2.607
    95% confidence interval: (-3.044, -2.17)

Test summary:
    outcome with 95% confidence: reject h_0
    two-sided p-value:           <1e-30

Details:
    number of observations:   [300,300]
    z-statistic:              -11.68408198645671
    population standard error: 0.223124076245086

title: Parametric Hypothesis Tests
text:
One Sample T Test

onesamplettest = let 
    x1 = filter(
        [:Sex, :Region, :Year] => 
            (s, r, y) -> s=="Men" && r=="Rural" && y == 2017,
        data
    ) |>
    x -> x[!, :BMI] |> skipmissing |> collect |> x->rand(x, 300)
    OneSampleTTest(x1, 24.5)
end

One sample t-test
-----------------
Population details:
    parameter of interest:   Mean
    value under h_0:         24.5
    point estimate:          25.1827
    95% confidence interval: (24.86, 25.51)

Test summary:
    outcome with 95% confidence: reject h_0
    two-sided p-value:           <1e-04

Details:
    number of observations:   300
    t-statistic:              4.155804212350372
    degrees of freedom:       299
    empirical standard error: 0.16426824551500577

title: Parametric Hypothesis Tests
text:
Unpaired 2 Sample Test
unpairedtwosamplettest = let 
    x1 = filter([:Sex, :Region, :Year] => 
            (s, r, y) -> s=="Women" && r=="Rural" && y == 1985,
        data) |>
        x -> x[!, :BMI] |> skipmissing |> collect |> x->rand(x, 300)
    x2 = filter([:Sex, :Region, :Year] => 
            (s, r, y) -> s=="Women" && r=="Urban" && y == 1985,
        data) |>
        x -> x[!, :BMI] |> skipmissing |> collect |> x->rand(x, 300)
    x -> x[!, :BMI] |> skipmissing |> collect |> x->rand(x, 300)
    UnequalVarianceTTest(x1, x2)
end






Welchâ€™s Test



This test uses the Welch correction, and there is no way to turn it off in HypothesisTests.jl.



Only considering Right tailed

unpairedtwosamplettest = let 
    x1 = filter([:Sex, :Region, :Year] => 
            (s, r, y) -> s=="Women" && r=="Rural" && y == 1985,
        data) |>
        x -> x[!, :BMI] |> skipmissing |> collect |> x->rand(x, 300)
    x2 = filter([:Sex, :Region, :Year] => 
            (s, r, y) -> s=="Women" && r=="Urban" && y == 1985,
        data) |>
        x -> x[!, :BMI] |> skipmissing |> collect |> x->rand(x, 300)
    x -> x[!, :BMI] |> skipmissing |> collect |> x->rand(x, 300)
    UnequalVarianceTTest(x1, x2)
end
pvalue(unpairedtwosamplettest, tail=:right)

0.9999999806397162

title: Parametric Hypothesis Tests
text:
Paired 2 Sample Test

pairedtwosamplettest = let 
    x1 = filter([:Sex, :Region, :Year] => 
            (s, r, y) -> s=="Women" && r=="Rural" && y == 1985,
        data) |>
        x -> x[!, :BMI] |> skipmissing |> collect |> x->rand(x, 300)
    x2 = filter([:Sex, :Region, :Year] => 
            (s, r, y) -> s=="Women" && r=="Urban" && y == 1985,
        data) |>
        x -> x[!, :BMI] |> skipmissing |> collect |> x->rand(x, 300)
    x -> x[!, :BMI] |> skipmissing |> collect |> x->rand(x, 300)
    EqualVarianceTTest(x1, x2)
end

Two sample t-test (equal variance)
----------------------------------
Population details:
    parameter of interest:   Mean difference
    value under h_0:         0
    point estimate:          -0.874333
    95% confidence interval: (-1.304, -0.4449)

Test summary:
    outcome with 95% confidence: reject h_0
    two-sided p-value:           <1e-04

Details:
    number of observations:   [300,300]
    t-statistic:              -3.9986799300954496
    degrees of freedom:       598
    empirical standard error: 0.21865549346743088
